intro: Obione barclayana, commonly known as the Barclay's obione, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a hairy texture. Obione barclayana is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
